subject: Gardening
title: Vavilov's Seed Collection
description: A quick, practical guide to Vavilov's Seed Collection.

hook.text: During the siege of Leningrad, scientists starved to death guarding a seed bank rather than eating its contents.

buildup.text: Nikolai Vavilov traveled 5 continents collecting seeds to protect crop diversity for future food security.

discovery.text: His collection of 250,000 seed samples was the world's largestâ€”an insurance policy against agricultural disaster.

twist.text: Stalin imprisoned Vavilov for opposing the pseudoscience of Lysenko. Vavilov died of starvation in prison in 1943.

climax.text: His colleagues protected the seeds through 900 days of siege. Twelve staff members died of hunger beside edible seeds.

punchline.text: Scientists chose to starve rather than eat the future.

quiz.question: Why did scientists at the Vavilov seed bank starve during the siege of Leningrad?
options: They had no way to cook the seeds in the collection
They chose to protect the irreplaceable seed collection rather than eat it
The seeds were toxic and couldn't be consumed
